cyclone.name: HENRI
cyclone.current_location: about 135 mi SSE of Montauk Point, New York
cyclone.trajectory: tracking north-northwest toward Long Island and southern New England
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southern New England or eastern Long Island, NY

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm-surge and hurricane watches from East Rockaway Inlet NY to Mastic NY and north of Chatham MA to Sagamore Beach MA; Cape Cod Bay
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane warnings Fire Island Inlet NY to Montauk Point NY and New Haven CT to Westport MA; Tropical-storm warnings Long Island south shore west of Fire Island Inlet NY to Manasquan Inlet NJ and coastal CT/MA including Nantucket & Martha’s Vineyard
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Long Island, Connecticut, Rhode Island, Massachusetts and adjacent New England coast
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Possible – forecast totals 3-6 inches across parts of NJ/SE PA
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Unlikely – Delaware River surge expected under 3 ft
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions with occasional gusts 25–35 mph; low (8 %) chance of sustained tropical-storm force winds
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor tidal rise possible along Delaware River, generally <3 ft
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands Sunday into Monday could total 2–4 inches with localized higher amounts causing urban/river flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Flash-flood potential, swollen river currents, reduced visibility and slick terminal surfaces impacting cargo handling
